name: Children who killed for Christ in Bethlehem
Father Marcellus, Hegumen of the Monastery of the Sleepless Ones
troparia: (Tone 1) We beseech you, O Lord and Lover of mankind,* and implore You through all the sufferings Your saints endured for You;* heal all our pain and suffering.

(Tone 8) In you, O holy father Marcellus, the faithful image of God shone forth,* for you carried your cross and followed Christ.* You taught by your deeds how to spurn the body, for it passes away;* and how to value the soul, for it is immortal.* Therefore, your soul is forever in happiness with the angels.
kontakia: (Tone 6) When the King was born in Bethlehem,* wise men came from the East and brought Him gifts.* They had been led by a star on high.* As for Herod, he became exceedingly angry* and had the infants harvested like lamenting wheat;* for he sees his power coming to an end.

(Tone 2) You rose in the East like a glittering star,* and you thundered with virtuous deeds, O blessed Marcellus.* You were a standard for a community of monks,* and you have become a light for the capitol, O venerable father.* This is why we sing to you:* Rejoice, O most blessed father.
